cardinfo.CI: Dillenia - Elephant Apple Tree/Elephant Apple Tree - Canopy.jpg

V: Elephant Apple is an evergreen large shrub or small to medium-sized tree growing to 15 m tall. It is native to southeastern Asia, from India and Sri Lanka east to southwestern China and Vietnam, and south through Thailand to Malaysia and Indonesia. The leaves are 15-36 cm long, with a conspicuously corrugated surface with impressed veins, like potato chips. The flowers are large, up to 5 inches across, with five white petals and numerous yellow stamens. Flowers arise solitary at the ends of the twigs, facing downward. The sepals are rounded and yellowish green. The fruit is a 5-12 cm diameter aggregate of 15 carpels, each carpel containing five seeds embedded in an edible pulp. The fruit pulp is used in Indian Cuisine in curries, jam, and jellies.

Common: Indian catmon, Hondapara tree, Large flowered dillenia, Matad
Assamese: Outenga, Ou-tenga, Panchkol, Pascol-solta, ঔ টেঙা
Bengali: Chalta, চাইলতে, চালিতা, চালতা
Hindi: Chalta, Chulta, Gimar, Karambel, चलता पेड़
Kannada: Kaadu kanigala, Bettada kanigala, Betta kanagalu, ಬೆಟ್ಟಕಣಿಗಲು ಮರ
Malayalam: Punna, Vazhapunna, Pinnay, മലമ്പുന്ന
Marathi: Mota karmal, Karambel
Sanskrit: Avartaki
Tamil: Ugakkay, Kurukatti, Kattaral, Uva, உவா மரம்
Telugu: Uva, పెద్దకళింగ, రేవడిచెట్టు
